revised_title: Innervation and Reflexes of Antagonistic Muscles: Successive Spinal Induction
tldr: This study investigates the innervation and reflexes of antagonistic muscles in spinal animals, specifically focusing on the'mark-time' reflex and the inhibitory effects of tail stimulation. The author demonstrates that the reflex is initiated by bilateral stimuli above the knee and that tail stimulation can inhibit the reflex, leading to an increased amplitude and frequency upon its return.
